result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Carson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing July 1, 2015 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Time served.  With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Carson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and enters judgment and orders 30 days jail with Huber, time served and costs of $443.00 to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7-1-15 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CM3 Ozaukee Co)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Counsel represents defendant as SPD appointment on an Ozaukee Co. case and will be appointed on this case.  State request $1,000.00 cash bond, counsel request a signature bond but if cash bond ordered request no more than $100.00.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:45 am.
